revisions.rev: {|{{Infobox Aircraft Begin |name= Windecker YE-5 |image=File:Windecker YE-5A.jpg |size=160 |caption=The YE-5A prototype }}{{Infobox Aircraft Type |type= Experimental [[Stealth technology|stealth]] aircraft |manufacturer= [[Windecker Industries]] |primary user= [[United States Air Force]] |more users= |unit cost= |designer= |first flight= 1973 |introduced= |retired= 1985 |status= |produced= |number built=1 |developed from = [[Windecker Eagle]] |variants with their own articles= |developed into = }} |} The '''Windecker YE-5A''' was an experimental [[aircraft]] evaluated by the [[United States Air Force|U.S. Air Force]]. It was an all-[[Composite material|composite]] construction aircraft, based on the commercial single-engine, low-wing [[Windecker Eagle]]. The YE-5A, delivered in [[1973 in aviation|1973]], was used in tests relating to the [[radar]] detectability (commonly known as '[[Stealth technology|stealth]]') of composite aircraft. The composite airframe was shown to be difficult to detect using radar; however other components, including the metal [[Piston engine|engine]], could be seen on radar. The aircraft was then transferred to the [[United States Army|U.S. Army]] for use in further tests. A single YE-5A (serial number 73-1653) was built. This aircraft was destroyed in a crash during flight testing, and was replaced by a conventional civilian model Windecker Eagle. This aircraft is disassembled and in storage in the [[United States Army Aviation Museum]] at [[Fort Rucker]], [[Alabama]].[http://www.eaglebehindthecurtain.com/WindeckerEagle/tabid/55/Default.aspx] ''Eagle Behind the Curtain''. Accessed 2010-06-10. ==Specifications (YE-5A)== {{aircraft specifications| |plane or copter?=plane |jet or prop?=prop |crew= one pilot |length main=28 ft 8 in |length alt= 8.7 m |span main= 32 ft |span alt= 9.8 m |height main= 9 ft 6 in |height alt= 2.9 m |area main=ftÂ² |area alt= mÂ² |empty weight main= 2,150 lb |empty weight alt= 975 kg |loaded weight main= 3,400 lb |loaded weight alt= 1,500 kg |max takeoff weight main=lb |max takeoff weight alt= kg |engine (prop)= [[Lycoming O-540|Lycoming I0-540-G]] |type of prop= |number of props= 1 |power main= 290 hp |power alt= 216 kW |max speed main= 210 mph at sea level |max speed alt= 338 km/h |cruise speed main= 204 mph 75% power |cruise speed alt= 328 km/h |stall speed main= 66 mph flaps down |stall speed alt= 106 km/h |range main= 1,100 miles |range alt= 1,770 km |ceiling main= 8,000 ft |ceiling alt= 5,500 m |climb rate main= 1,220 ft/min |climb rate alt= 6 m/s |loading main= 19.3 lb/ftÂ² |loading alt= kg/mÂ² |power/mass main= 0.09 hp/lb |power/mass alt= 0.14 kW/kg }} ==References== {{reflist}} {{US EW aircraft}} {{aviation lists}} {{aero-1970s-stub}} [[Category:United States experimental aircraft 1970â1979|E-5, Windecker]] [[Category:Windecker aircraft|E-5]] [[Category:Stealth aircraft]]
